private_information: I have the full catalogue of primitive actions: paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted
For each action I can enumerate the required positive facts and deterministic add/delete effects
modeler.goal: Produce a faithful, structured model fragment that captures action preconditions and effects without emitting a final PDDL file

private_information: I can apply actions to an initial state to produce traces and detect unreachable goals or clashes
I have the candidate plan described by the user and several initial-state variants
simulator.goal: Validate the candidate plan and produce a simulation trace and counterexamples as structured data

private_information: I specialize in temporal and causal consistency auditing and in removing bookkeeping shortcuts such as quota tokens and post-hoc penalties
I will identify implicit bookkeeping shortcuts and propose explicit causal constraints or removals
auditor.goal: Audit the model and the simulation traces for causal cycles, temporal impossibilities, and bookkeeping shortcuts and provide remediation recommendations

private_information: I coordinate inputs from the modeler, simulator, and auditor and produce the final PDDL domain and problem targeted to the FastDownward solver
orchestrator.goal: Integrate fragments and corrections to emit a complete PDDL domain and problem suitable for FastDownward

init.notes: Objects are named object_0 through object_13

public_information: Actions available: paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted
Action paltry requires facts hand object_0, cats object_1, texture object_2, vase object_0 object_1, next object_1 object_2 and yields next object_0 object_2 and deletes vase object_0 object_1
Action sip requires hand object_0, cats object_1, texture object_2, next object_0 object_2, next object_1 object_2 and yields vase object_0 object_1 and deletes next object_0 object_2
Action clip requires hand object_0, sneeze object_1, texture object_2, next object_1 object_2, next object_0 object_2 and yields vase object_0 object_1 and deletes next object_0 object_2

Action wretched requires sneeze object_0, texture object_1, texture object_2, stupendous object_3, next object_0 object_1, collect object_1 object_3, collect object_2 object_3 and yields next object_0 object_2 and deletes next object_0 object_1
Action memory requires cats object_0, spring object_1, spring object_2, next object_0 object_1 and yields next object_0 object_2 and deletes next object_0 object_1
Action tightfisted requires hand object_0, sneeze object_1, texture object_2, next object_1 object_2, vase object_0 object_1 and yields next object_0 object_2 and deletes vase object_0 object_1

Initial facts variant A include cats object_0, cats object_1, collect object_6 object_2, collect object_7 object_2, collect object_8 object_3, collect object_9 object_3, hand object_10, hand object_11, hand object_12, hand object_13, next object_0 object_6, next object_1 object_6, next object_10 object_9, next object_11 object_8, next object_12 object_9, next object_13 object_6, next object_4 object_7, next object_5 object_9, sneeze object_4, sneeze object_5, spring object_6, spring object_8, stupendous object_2, stupendous object_3, texture object_6, texture object_7, texture object_8, texture object_9

Initial facts variant B include cats object_0, cats object_1, collect object_6 object_2, collect object_7 object_2, collect object_8 object_3, collect object_9 object_3, hand object_10, hand object_11, hand object_12, hand object_13, next object_0 object_8, next object_1 object_8, next object_10 object_7, next object_11 object_9, next object_12 object_8, next object_13 object_9, next object_4 object_7, next object_5 object_9, sneeze object_4, sneeze object_5, spring object_6, spring object_8, stupendous object_2, stupendous object_3, texture object_6, texture object_7, texture object_8, texture object_9
User goal examples include next object_10 object_6, next object_11 object_9, next object_12 object_7, next object_13 object_9 or variants thereof
A user-provided candidate plan is available as a sequence of action applications to be used for simulation and validation

analysis.system_prompt: You are a domain modeler. Read the public action catalog and produce a structured machine-readable fragment that lists each action name with its explicit positive preconditions, add effects, and delete effects. Do not produce a final PDDL domain or problem. Emit a JSON-compatible fragment naming objects and predicates consistently.
analysis.prompt: Your name is modeler. You have the following public information: {environment->public_information} You also have these private notes: {agents->modeler->private_information} Your task is to produce a clear structured model fragment with action schemas, preconditions, add effects, and delete effects. Do not emit complete PDDL. If information is missing, mark the unknowns explicitly.

simulate.system_prompt: You are a forward simulator and plan validator. Use the provided initial-state variants and the candidate plan to generate state traces, identify where preconditions fail, and collect causal dependencies. Do not emit PDDL files. Provide trace logs and summarized failure points as structured data.
simulate.prompt: Your name is simulator. You have the following public information: {environment->public_information} You also have these private notes: {agents->simulator->private_information} Your task is to run the candidate plan(s) against the initial-state variants, produce explicit state traces, and report any precondition violations or unexpected effects.

audit.system_prompt: You are an auditor focused on temporal and causal consistency. Identify cycles, simultaneity assumptions, and bookkeeping shortcuts such as implicit tokens or post-hoc penalties. Propose concrete model edits or explicit constraints that remove such shortcuts. Output structured recommendations and do not produce PDDL.
audit.prompt: Your name is auditor. You have the public information: {environment->public_information} and these private notes: {agents->auditor->private_information} Your task is to inspect model fragments and simulation traces and to produce remediation recommendations to ensure causal and temporal clarity.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator that must integrate model fragments, simulation traces, and auditor recommendations to generate a complete PDDL domain and PDDL problem targeted for the FastDownward solver. Produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep agent-specific actions distinct and preserve predicate naming consistency. Apply auditor recommendations to remove bookkeeping shortcuts and ensure temporal/causal consistency. The output must be ready to feed to FastDownward.
pddl.prompt: Your name is orchestrator. You will receive the model fragment, the simulation traces, and the auditor recommendations as inputs. Integrate these inputs to create a single consistent PDDL domain and a single PDDL problem that aim to achieve the stated user goal(s) from the appropriate initial-state variant. Keep the actions semantically distinct per agent where relevant. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> tags and the problem between <problem></problem> tags.
